intro: Munnozia trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined munnozia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and have three prominent veins, which is a distinguishing feature. Munnozia trinervis is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
